info.name: Official Akeneo PIM API
info.description:
The Akeneo API brought to you!

Find out how this Postman collection works by visiting http://api.akeneo.com

request.description: Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing association type
Assuming that there is no "new_association_type" already existing
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing attribute

body.raw:
{
  "code": "new_attribute",
  "type": "pim_catalog_boolean",
  "group": "technical",
  "unique": false,
  "useable_as_grid_filter": true,
  "allowed_extensions": [],
  "metric_family": null,
  "default_metric_unit": null,
  "reference_data_name": null,
  "available_locales": [],
  "max_characters": null,
  "validation_rule": null,
  "validation_regexp": null,
  "wysiwyg_enabled": null,
  "number_min": null,
  "number_max": null,
  "decimals_allowed": null,
  "negative_allowed": null,
  "date_min": null,
  "date_max": null,
  "max_file_size": null,
  "minimum_input_length": null,
  "sort_order": 39,
  "localizable": false,
  "scopable": false,
  "labels": {
    "de_DE": "new attribute label DE",
    "en_US": "new attribute label US",
    "fr_FR": "new attribute label FR"
  }
}

request.description: Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing attribute group
Assuming that there is no "new_attribute_group" already existing
Assuming that the given codes are respectively the code of an existing attribute and an existing option of this attribute
Assuming that there is no "yellow" option already existing for the given attribute
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing attribute
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing category
Assuming that there is no "new_category" already existing
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing channel
Assuming that there is no "new_channel" already existing
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing currency
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing family

body.raw:
{
  "code": "new_family",
  "attributes": [
    "container_material",
    "description",
    "main_color",
    "name",
    "picture",
    "price",
    "sku"
  ],
  "attribute_as_label": "name",
  "attribute_as_image": "picture",
  "attribute_requirements": {
    "ecommerce": [
      "container_material",
      "description",
      "main_color",
      "name",
      "price",
      "sku"
    ],
    "mobile": [
      "description",
      "main_color",
      "name",
      "price",
      "sku"
    ],
    "print": [
      "description",
      "name",
      "price",
      "sku"
    ]
  },
  "labels": {
    "de_DE": "new family label DE",
    "en_US": "new family label US",
    "fr_FR": "new family label FR"
  }
}

request.description: Assuming that there is no "new_family" already existing
Assuming that the given codes are respectively the code of an existing family and an existing family variant
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing locale
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing measure family
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing media file
Assuming that the given identifier is the identifier of an existing product and that the given attribute code exists
Assuming that the given identifier is the identifier of an existing product
Assuming that there is no "new_product" already existing
Assuming that the given identifier is the identifier of an existing product

Assuming that there is already a draft for the given product. The draft was created by the same user that using this request.
The user has only an edition permission through categories on the given product.

Assuming that there is already a draft for the given product. The draft was created by the same user using this request.
The user has only an edition permission through categories on the given product.
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing product model

body.raw:
{"code": "new_product_model", "family_variant": "clothing_colorsize", "values": { "name": [{"locale": null, "scope": null, "data": "A new product model"}]}}
{"code": "amor", "family_variant": "clothing_colorsize", "values": { "name": [{"locale": null, "scope": null, "data": "A new product model"}]}}

request.description: Assuming that the given identifier is the identifier of an existing product that is currently published
